newsitem.title: USA: AT&T names two firms to assist CEO search.
newsitem.headline: AT&T names two firms to assist CEO search.

text.p: AT&T Corp said on Wednesday it chose two firms -- Hendrick & Struggles Inc and Spencer Stuart -- to assist in the search for a chief executive to succeed Robert Allen, its chairman and CEO.

AT&T's board said in a statement it planned to conduct the search as expeditiously as possible, considering both internal and external candidates, but it declined to set a deadline for naming the successor.
The telecommunications company set up a committee to find a successor for Allen following the July 16 resignation of John Walter, the company's former president.

Walter, who had been tapped to become AT&T's next chairman, resigned after the company's board declined to give him the promised promotion. He had been expected to succeed Allen as CEO in January 1998, AT&T said.
Terms of the board's agreements with the two firms and other details of the search were not disclosed.

Members of the search committee are Kenneth Derr, chairman and CEO of Chevron Corp, Walter Elisha, chairman and CEO of Springs Industries Inc, Donald McHenry, president of IRC Group, Ralph Larsen, chairman and CEO of Johnson & Johnson and Thomas Wyman, senior advisor of SBC Warburg Inc.
Allen has agreed to remain chairman and CEO while the search is conducted.
